intro: Elaphoglossum rojasii, commonly known as the Rojas' holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, leathery fronds that are typically dark green and glossy. This plant is native to the cloud forests of Central and South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Elaphoglossum rojasii has a rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to spread slowly through underground stems. Its unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
